org.safs.text

Class Comparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.text.Comparator

  • public class Comparator
extends java.lang.Object
    Provide different types of text comparisons:

    • glob : supports "*" and "?" wildcarding.
    • regexp: case-sensitive matches based on a regular expression.
    • regexpi: matches based on a regular expression, ignoring case.
    • exact: an exact verbatim match.
    Author:
    Carl Nagle

    • Method Detail

      • isGlobMatch

        public static boolean isGlobMatch(java.lang.String text,
                                  java.lang.String glob)
        Attempt a 'glob' pattern match on a given text string. The pattern supports "*" and "?" wildcarding of a case-insensitive compare.

        The 'glob:' pattern prefix (Selenium 1.0) is assumed to already be removed.

        Parameters:
        text - String to compare against the 'glob' pattern.
        glob - String pattern to use for comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the text matches the provided 'glob' pattern. false otherwise. if both parameters are null this is considered a match.

      • isExactMatch

        public static boolean isExactMatch(java.lang.String text,
                                   java.lang.String bench)
        Attempt an 'exact' pattern match on a given text string.
        The pattern is assumed to be an exact text match.

        The 'exact:' pattern prefix (Selenium 1.0) is assumed to already be removed.

        Parameters:
        text - String to compare against the bench pattern.
        bench - String to match exactly.
        Returns:
        true if the text matches the provided bench pattern exactly. false otherwise. if both parameters are null this is considered a match.

      • isRegexpMatch

        public static boolean isRegexpMatch(java.lang.String text,
                                    java.lang.String regexp)
        Attempt a 'regexp' pattern match on a given text string.
        The pattern is assumed to be a regular expression.

        The 'regexp:' pattern prefix (Selenium 1.0) is assumed to already be removed.

        Parameters:
        text - String to compare against the 'regexp' pattern.
        regexp - String pattern.
        Returns:
        true if the text matches the 'regexp' pattern. false otherwise. if both parameters are null this is considered a match.

      • isRegexpiMatch

        public static boolean isRegexpiMatch(java.lang.String text,
                                     java.lang.String regexp)
        Attempt a 'regexp' pattern match on a given text string, ignoring case.

        The 'regexpi:' pattern prefix (Selenium 1.0) is assumed to already be removed.

        Parameters:
        text - String to compare against the 'regexp' pattern.
        regexp - String pattern.
        Returns:
        true if the text matches the 'regexp' pattern, ignoring case. false otherwise. if both parameters are null this is considered a match.
